description: "On 24 March the government of Antigua and Barbuda announced with immediate effect the consolidation of its maritime border on the island of Antigua. All international maritime arrivals must enter via Nevis Street Pier in St John뭩." "Yachts are not permitted to enter Antigua and Barbuda, regardless of which country they have arrived from, and regardless of the nationality or residential status of those on board. Travellers arriving from Montserrat are being screened, which may result in extended travel time."

The existing travel ban for some countries has been expanded for foreign nationals, who have visited the United States, Canada and all European countries in the 28 days before. All incoming foreign flights have been cancelled. These new measures are starting at the 26th of March according to the government of Antigua and Barbuda.
target_who_what: All Foreign Nationals (Foreign Residents + Foreign Travelers)
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: The UK is providing 3.8m US$ for Covid-19 responses in the Caribbean. Also Antigua and Barbuda will benefit from the money. This was announced on May 22nd. The Pan American Health Organisation (PAHO) will receive the money and help the contributing nations with e.g. health ressources.

The UK is providing 3.8m US$ for Covid-19 responses in the Caribbean. Also Antigua and Barbuda will benefit from the money. This was announced on May 22nd. The Pan American Health Organisation (PAHO) will receive the money and help the contributing nations with e.g. health ressources.
Press release of the Barbudan Government states "CARPHA, PAHO and the EU Partner to Guarantee Equitable Access to COVID-19 Vaccine" on October 16th.

The Ministry of Public Utilities, Civil Aviation, Transportation and Energy of Antigua and Barbuda released a Travel Advisory on May 22nd. There it presented the hygiene protocols for the reopening of the island on June 1st. Measures like a negative Covid-19 test, eventual quarantine and special certifications are published.
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The official Barbudan Covid-19 Dashboard indicates 3725 total tested, 4063 total sampels taken and 130 total confirmed cases as of November 3rd 2020.

In an official statement of the Government of Antigua and Barbuda on April 22 it was stated that: "In addition to social distancing, owners of businesses permitted operate during the curfew period shall ensure that there is a sanitizing station available at the entry to the business and sanitary procedures are observed by all customers."
The government of Antigua and Barbuda is enforcing a nationwide curfew with few exceptions from 28th of March for two weeks. The curfew will be in place from 8PM to 6AM.
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

type_text: The Caribbean Developement Bank granted a emergency loan over US$ 13 million to Antigua and Barbuda on May the 18th.

description: The government of Antigua and Barbuda announced on the 22nd of March, that gatherings of more than 25 persons are prohibited. In a media statement of the government from the 25th of March, the officials recognized multiple violations of the restriction.

"Prison visits and court cases across Antigua and Barbuda are suspended for two weeks to reduce the risk of coronavirus (COVID-19) transmissions. The Ministry said the suspension of prison visits also affects food and water drop-offs for inmates. Only the Prison Farm Gang members can enter and leave Her Majesty뭩 Prison. At the courts, some trials that have already started will continue and emergency applications heard but the Magistrates Court will continue to function under a very strict regulatory regime.
The Civil Registry will operate a next day service, where a drop box will be provided for drop-offs, while emergency applications will be facilitated.
Only three people will be allowed to enter the Land Registry and Intellectual Property Departments at a time.
The Legal Aid and Advice Centre will also be limiting public contact to one person per session. Scheduled interview sessions will be done via telephone and a drop off box will be provided for required documents."

A statement by the Antigua Public Utility Authority informed the public about social distancing and hygiene measures on March 16th. "Senior citizens will be given priority in customer lines, to limit exposure, controlled lines at our payment centers will be enforced, utilization of sanitization stationswill be made compulsory upon entrance of offices, a designated waiting area will be provided to facilitate the recommended social distance."
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Even though the Government of Antigua and Barbuda introduced a curfew before, the official statement published on April 22 included detailed social distancing rules for businesses, which are allowed to open during the curfew. "Ensure that all customers and staff maintain physical distancing of no less than six feet in or around their business; determine the number of persons that may be permitted in the establishment at any one time by permitting one person for every fifty square feet of store space; place distance markers at six feet interval showing where persons are permitted to stand at a check out point; place distance markers at six feet interval to show where persons are permitted to stand while waiting outside of the establishment"
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines
